info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued November 04 at 7:41PM CDT until November 05 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 PM CDT FOR LITTLE RIVER AND CENTRAL BOWIE COUNTIES... At 741 PM CDT, a confirmed large and extremely dangerous tornado was located 8 miles north of New Boston, moving northeast at 50 mph. This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. TAKE COVER NOW! HAZARD...Damaging tornado. SOURCE...Radar confirmed tornado. IMPACT...You are in a life-threatening situation. Flying debris may be deadly to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be destroyed. Considerable damage to homes, businesses, and vehicles is likely and complete destruction is possible. The tornado will be near... Foreman and Richmond around 750 PM CDT. Ashdown and Wilton around 800 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Wallace, Pine Prairie, Arden, Red Bank, Millwood and Leary. TORNADO...OBSERVED TORNADO DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN
info.instruction: Tornadoes are extremely difficult to see and confirm at night. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW!
